key_points: The author asks their therapist about the Ever Given, a container ship stuck in the Suez Canal.
Ever Given, operated by Evergreen, got stuck sideways in the Suez Canal, causing significant attention.
The ship, longer than the Empire State Building, has become the focus of global attention through photographs and memes.
The author describes their fascination with the ship and the global shipping industry it has inadvertently highlighted.
The Ever Given's predicament has illustrated the normally invisible infrastructure of global capital and supply chains.
More than 150 other large shipping vessels are waiting due to the blockage in a critical global shipping lane.
The incident is causing substantial financial losses for financiers, shipping magnates, and insurance companies.
Global shipping, crucial for transporting consumer goods, remains largely out of public sight under normal circumstances.
The scenario underscores issues in global manufacturing and shipping, including labor and logistical challenges.
The grounding of the Ever Given has made visible the vulnerabilities and complexities of the global shipping system.
